intro: Rorippa subumbellata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed watercress, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist soils along riverbanks, ditches, and wet meadows. The plant has small, alternate leaves that are broadly ovate to elliptic in shape, often with a waxy coating. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is known for its peppery flavor and has been used in traditional cuisine and herbal medicine.
